intro: Tithymalus cybirensis, commonly known as the Cybirensis tithymalus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
